SYNOPSIS:- Badal 1966
A Simple woman in a village sends her son with an amulet to present himself before the sick king and instructs him to do as the king commands. This simple village lad, Badal, who has lived his life in poetry goes to the town and is misunderstood by everyone he meets including SHeroo, the inn owner, his daughter Bijuriya, and even the palace guards when he atempts to see the king. The puzzled youth tries to escape from the palace and witness the king being assinated by the Mahamantri. Sheroo realizes the bravery of the young lad Badal, and both of them decide to raise their voice against the Mahamantri and his despotic actions and Azad Shair, the poet of rebellion is thus born. No one knows who it this Azad Shair. Is he and Old Man? or a young man? or is this a woman?, but everyone hears the voice of Azad Shair, and a rebellion is aroused uin the hearts of the people against the tyrant Mahamantri. The rightful heir to the throne declares himself when the Mahamantri proclaims himself king. Who is this rightful heir? WHo is Azad SHair? And who becomes the king. The thrilling climax of BADAL holds the key to all of these questions
